title: To the Editor: O'Carroll et al. (1997) reported that performance on the delayed word recall (DWR) test failed to discriminate clearly between depression and Alzheimer's disease (AD), and that the Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) was superior to the DWR test in this capacity.
abstract: To the Editor: O'Carroll et al. (1997) reported that performance on the delayed word recall (DWR) test failed to discriminate clearly between depression and Alzheimer's disease (AD), and that the Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) was superior to the DWR test in this capacity. - Volume 28 Issue 2
